page.title: 09Road and Rail in Insch.
page.content: In 1970 the double track railway was replaced by a single track.There are nine passenger trains daily from Monday to Saturday and three on Sunday.The return fares from Insch to Aberdeen are:Adults Â£3.80; Children Â£1.90;and O.A.P's Â£3.80 if they don't own a Railcard. The bus service by W.Alexander and Sons Ltd. provides seven buses which pass through Insch on weekdays,five on Saturdays,and three on Sundays.The route taken passes through the Square, and the return fares from Insch to Aberdeen are:Adults Â£4.20; O.A.P.'s and Children Â£2.10. The lack of job opportunities in Insch means many people commute,by car especially,to Aberdeen,Dyce,Inverurie and Huntly. Insch folk appear happy with their road and rail services.
